sense.name: to show differences when compared
sense.commentary: Note: Intransitive. Syntax Includes: NP1 CONTRAST WITH NP2 NP[patient[plural]] CONTRAST Includes: CONTRAST WITH
sense.examples: The absence of HIV infection contrasts with a high prevalence of sexual transmitted diseases. The students contrast considerably in their artistic abilities.

sense.name: put in opposition to show or emphasize differences
sense.commentary: Note: Transitive. Syntax Is: NP1 CONTRAST NP2
sense.examples: We contrasted the performance of the two groups during the pretest. It contrasted the preoccupations and conversations of Jews and gentiles.
